page.title: 16Two Historic Houses
page.content: {Came House}is very conspicuous, as it is an isolated greyish white Georgian building, surrounded by the lush green woods and fields of the Winterborne Valley. Major Martin's wife's family have been connected with Came House since 1754, when it was built to a design by Francis Cartwright. It is built of Broadmayne brick, and faced with Portland stone. {Herringston House}is now lived in by Major General Williams, whose family have been there for over 500 years. There has been a settlement since Saxon times because of the abundance of water from the ground and flint for tools from the local chalk pits. The present house is Victorian with castellations above its family motto "Nil Solidum" Nothing is Eternal.
